oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On a trilinear singular integral form with determinantal kernel
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gressman, Philip
He, Danqing
Kovač, Vjekoslav
Street, Brian
Thiele, Christoph
Yung, Po-Lam
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Classical Analysis and ODEs
42B20
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study a trilinear singular integral form acting on two-dimensional functions and possessing invariances under arbitrary matrix dilations and linear modulations. One part of the motivation for introducing it lies in its large symmetry groups acting on the Fourier side. Another part of the motivation is that this form stands between the bilinear Hilbert transforms and the first Calder\'on commutator, in the sense that it can be reduced to a superposition of the former, while it also successfully encodes the latter. As the main result we determine the exact range of exponents in which the ${L}^p$ estimates hold for the considered form.
